title: Front Brake Disc - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
To avoid wheel damage, always support the wheel as instructed below. A dangerous riding condition leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident could result if this warning is ignored.
The fixings securing the left hand brake disc to the wheel also secures the ABS pulser ring.
Note the orientation of the brake discs and the ABS pulser ring fitted for installation.
Support the wheel on blocks to avoid damage to the wheel centre and brake disc.
Remove and discard the brake disc fixings and remove the brake disc and the ABS pulser ring, if fitted.
The edge of the front brake damper is tapered and will fit in only one way. Note the orientation of the front brake damper for installation.
Repeat steps 3 and 4 for the other side.
